a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Income inequality vs. GDP per capita, 2021
The Gini coefficient measures inequality on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality. GDP is
adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
Source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2022); Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
Note: GDP data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, inequality data relates to income measured
after taxes and benefits, or consumption, per capita.
